This project sought to draw attention to the environmental and economic issues facing the remote and isolated communities of the Scottish Highlands and islands by using the medium of text. The title of the piece is the opening phrase from the Gaelic poem ‘An Pobarlach’ by Sorley MacLean. The text appeared on 12 separate stones, scattered around An Lùib Mòr (The Big Pond) on the Isle of Harris, Scotland. The idea was to leave the stones as a relic, something which the community (and any passing visitors) could find, read and interact with at their own pace. There is no online counterpart to this project.

I remember my surprise to see a large number of Scottish National Party (SNP) flags lining the roads outside the venue of the speech: the Caird Hall.
